questions.question: 4.Which parameter primarily affects the width of the central maximum in the diffraction pattern obtained from a single slit?

answers.c: The wavelength of the laser light

explanations.a: The width of the slit - The width of the central maximum in the diffraction pattern is primarily influenced by the width of the slit. A narrower slit results in a wider central maximum, and vice versa.

questions.question: 5.In a single-slit diffraction pattern, why do minima occur?

answers.a: They are due to the complete cancellation of light waves
answers.b: They are due to the partial absorption of light by the slit
answers.c: They occur because of the overlapping of reflected light waves
answers.d: They are due to the scattering of light waves at different angles

explanations.a: Minima occur due to the complete destructive interference of light waves from different parts of the slit. This results in points of minimum intensity.
